CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 2, 1945, pg. 22, reads: "Picnic Scene - This outdoor scene at the drama, 'I Am Bound for Canaan Land,' last Thursday evening in Schenley High School, was one of the most colorful in the entire production. The 'modern' mother, portrayed by Miss Clara Kelly (standing left), is shown giving the 'old-fashioned' mother, Mrs. Ruth Howard Hill (seated, with flower in hair), some pointers on not letting children mix in the democratic way. The affair was sponsored by the Humble Five Singers. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Eight children and three women, including Clara Kelly standing on left and Ruth Howard Hill seated on right, on stage with garden landscape backdrop for picnic scene in production of "I Am Bound for Canaan Land," in Schenely High School
